docs.title: Assetto Corsa Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the Assetto Corsa documentation! Here, you’ll find guides to help you set up, manage, and customize your Assetto Corsa server hosted on Wake Servers.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text:
• How to get "Servers" Tab in CM
  • How to add Cars
  • How to change the Map

docs.title: Adding Cars To Assetto Server
docs.text: Follow these steps to add cars to your Assetto Corsa server hosted on Wake Servers.

docs.title: Step 1: Select Your Server
docs.text:
1. Log in to your Wake Servers Game Panel.
  2. Click on your Assetto Corsa server.

docs.title: Step 2: Navigate to server_cfg.ini
docs.text:
1. Click on the Files tab.
  1. Open the cfg folder.
  1. Locate and click on the entry_list.ini file.

Inside the entry_list.ini file, you should see cars listed in this format:

[CAR_0]
MODEL=ks_mazda_mx5_cup
SKIN=00_official
SPECTATOR_MODE=0
DRIVERNAME=
TEAM=
GUID=
BALLAST=0
RESTRICTOR=0

These lines specify the current cars and their configuration.

docs.title: Step 3: Make Sure Your Cars Are Downloaded
docs.text:
To find a new cars, you can use trusted sources such as OverTake.gg.

Drag and Drop Your Map: Once you've downloaded your cars, drag and drop them into Content Manager.

Click on the drop down at the top right then click install.

docs.title: Step 4: Enable the Server Tab in Content Manager
docs.text: If the Server tab isn’t visible, follow these steps to enable it: 1. Open Content Manager. 2. Go to Settings > Content Manager > Appearance. 3. Check the box next to Server under Links.

docs.title: Step 5: Adding the cars in Content Manager
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Server tab in Content Manager.
  2. Click on the |+| at the bottem right to make a new server.
  3. Then select ENTRY LIST In the bar menu.
  4. The Press the |+| To add new cars.

docs.title: Step 5.1: Adding your cars
docs.text:
1. After pressing the |+| buttion you can choose the cars that you want and then click add at the bottem of the window.
  2. After pressing the |+| buttion you can choose the cars that you want and then click add at the bottem of the window.

Warning

Make sure that you do not add more cars then the server you bought can handle. For example if you have a 16 slots server dont add more then 16 cars.

docs.title: Step 6: Update entry_list.ini with your New Cars
docs.text:
1. On the bottem left of your server in Content Manager, Click save
  2. Then click on the Folder
  1. Open the entry_list.ini file and you should see something like this, For example:
[CAR_0]
MODEL=ks_lamborghini_huracan_gt3
SKIN=0_Racing_green
SPECTATOR_MODE=0
DRIVERNAME=
TEAM=
GUID=
BALLAST=0
RESTRICTOR=0

[CAR_1]
MODEL=ks_lamborghini_huracan_gt3
SKIN=0_Racing_green
SPECTATOR_MODE=0
DRIVERNAME=
TEAM=
GUID=
BALLAST=0
RESTRICTOR=0

Copy what you have in the entry_list.ini

  1. Go back to the Wake Servers Game Panel.
  2. Update the entry_list.ini file under cfg file under the Files tab.

docs.title: Step 7: Start the Server
docs.text:
1. Save your changes to the server_cfg.ini file.
  2. Return to the Console tab in the Wake Servers Game Panel.
  3. Click Start to launch your server with the new map.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
• Locate and update the entry_list.ini file in your game panel.
  • Use Content Manager to select new cars to add.
  • Copy the entry list from Content Manager.
  • Paste it into the entry_list.ini on the Webpanel

docs.title: Changing the Map in Assetto Corsa
docs.text: Follow these steps to change the map (track) for your Assetto Corsa server hosted on Wake Servers.

docs.title: Step 1: Select Your Server
docs.text:
1. Log in to your Wake Servers Game Panel.
  2. Click on your Assetto Corsa server.

docs.title: Step 2: Navigate to server_cfg.ini
docs.text:
1. Click on the Files tab.
  1. Open the cfg folder.
  1. Locate and click on the server_cfg.ini file.

Inside the server_cfg.ini file, locate the following lines:

TRACK                          = csp/1937/../imola
CONFIG_TRACK                   =

These lines specify the current map and its configuration.

docs.title: Step 3: Find Your Desired Map
docs.text:
To find a new map, you can use trusted sources such as OverTake.gg.

Drag and Drop Your Map: Once you've downloaded your map, drag and drop it into Content Manager. Here's a helpful GIF showing this process:

docs.title: Step 4: Enable the Server Tab in Content Manager
docs.text: If the Server tab isn’t visible, follow these steps to enable it: 1. Open Content Manager. 2. Go to Settings > Content Manager > Appearance. 3. Check the box next to Server under Links.

docs.title: Step 5: Change the Map in Content Manager
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Server tab in Content Manager.
  2. Click on the current map (default map) to open the map selection menu.
  3. Select your new map from the list or browse to it.
  1. Once you've selected the map, click OK and SAVE the changes.

docs.title: Step 6: Update server_cfg.ini with the New Map
docs.text:
1. Open the server_cfg.ini file in Content Manager or on the server.
  2. Copy the TRACK and CONFIG_TRACK values for your new map. For example:
TRACK                          = ks_nurburgring
CONFIG_TRACK                   = layout_gp_a
  1. Go back to the Wake Servers Game Panel.
  2. Update the TRACK and CONFIG_TRACK values in the server_cfg.ini file under the Files tab.

docs.title: Step 7: Start the Server
docs.text:
1. Save your changes to the server_cfg.ini file.
  2. Return to the Console tab in the Wake Servers Game Panel.
  3. Click Start to launch your server with the new map.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
• Locate and update the server_cfg.ini file in your game panel.
  • Use Content Manager to select and apply the new map.
  • Start your server to load the changes.

docs.title: How to get the "Servers" tab in Content Manager
docs.text: Setting up an Assetto Corsa server with Wake Servers is quick and easy. Follow these steps to get your server up and running:

docs.title: Enable the Server Tab in Content Manager
docs.text: If the Server tab isn’t visible, follow these steps to enable it: 1. Open Content Manager. 2. Go to Settings > Content Manager > Appearance. 3. Check the box next to Server under Links.

docs.title: BeamMP Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the BeamMP documentation! Here, you’ll find everything you need to get started with your BeamMP server.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text: • Installing Mods

docs.title: Installing Mods On BeamMP Server
docs.text: Adding mods to your BeamMP server hosted on Wake Servers is a straightforward process. Follow these steps to ensure your mods are installed correctly and available for your players.

docs.title: Step 1: Prepare Your Mod Files
docs.text:
1. Download the mod you want to install from a trusted source (e.g., BeamNG Repository).
  2. Ensure the mod is in .zip format and is compatible with the BeamMP server.

Tip: Avoid renaming the mod files, as it may cause issues with loading them properly.

docs.title: Step 2: Upload Your Mod to the Server
docs.text:
1. Log in to your Wake Servers game panel.
  2. Navigate to your BeamMP server instance.
  3. Locate the File Manager section in the server dashboard.
  4. Upload the .zip file to the following directory: /resources/mods/

    Note: If the mods folder doesn’t exist, create it manually.

Warning

You can not upload more than 100mb to the webpanel. In order to upload a high size file you must use SFTP under the Settings Tab of your server.

docs.title: What happens if a mod causes server crashes?
docs.text: • Simply remove the mod .zip file from the /resources/mods/ directory and restart the server.

docs.title: Can I install multiple mods at once?
docs.text: • Yes! Add each mod’s file name to the mods section of the server-config.json file.

docs.title: Where can I find more mods?
docs.text:
• Check out the BeamNG Community Repository for a wide selection of mods.

Congratulations! Your BeamMP server is now enhanced with custom mods. If you encounter any issues, don’t hesitate to reach out to Wake Servers support.

docs.title: Assetto Corsa Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the Assetto Corsa documentation! Here, you’ll find guides to help you set up, manage, and customize your Assetto Corsa server hosted on Wake Servers.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text: • Getting Started with tModLoader

docs.title: Adding Cars To Assetto Server
docs.text: Follow these steps to enable tModLoader for Terraria server hosted at Wake Servers.

docs.title: Step 1: Select Your Server
docs.text:
1. Log in to your Wake Servers Game Panel.
  2. Click on your Assetto Corsa server.

docs.title: Step 2: Navigate to Startup Tab
docs.text:
1. Click on the Files tab.
  1. Scroll down to the tModLoader option.

docs.title: Step 3: Turn On tModLoader And Reinstall Your Server
docs.text:
1. Turn on tModLoader.
  1. Go to the Settings tab.
  1. Scroll down to Reinstall Server Section.

docs.title: Step 4: Start the Server
docs.text:
1. Save your changes to the server_cfg.ini file.
  2. Return to the Console tab in the Wake Servers Game Panel.
  3. Click Start to launch your server with the new map.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
• Select Your Server.
  • Navigate to Startup Tab
  • Turn On tModLoader And Reinstall Your Server
  • Start the Server
